ChatGPT said:

Below is the complete code for your updated registration page (register.html) and the corresponding parts of your Flask app (app.py) that save the additional fields in an SQLite database called users.db.

register.html

html
{% extends "base.html" %}
{% block title %}Register{% endblock %}
{% block content %}
<div class="row justify-content-center">
    <div class="col-md-6 col-lg-4">
        <div class="register-card card mt-5">
            <div class="card-header bg-success text-white">
                <h3 class="text-center">
                    <i class="fas fa-user-plus me-2"></i>Register for Tennis App
                </h3>
            </div>
            <div class="card-body">
                <form method="POST" action="{{ url_for('register') }}">
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="first_name" class="form-label">Name</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-user"></i></span>
                            <input type="text" class="form-control" id="first_name" name="first_name" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="last_name" class="form-label">Surname</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-user"></i></span>
                            <input type="text" class="form-control" id="last_name" name="last_name" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="email" class="form-label">Email</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-envelope"></i></span>
                            <input type="email" class="form-control" id="email" name="email" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="phone" class="form-label">Phone</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-phone"></i></span>
                            <input type="number" class="form-control" id="phone" name="phone" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="birth_year" class="form-label">Year of Birth</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-calendar-alt"></i></span>
                            <!-- Using number input for a year-only widget -->
                            <input type="number" class="form-control" id="birth_year" name="birth_year" placeholder="YYYY" min="1900" max="2023" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="handedness" class="form-label">Handedness</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-hand-paper"></i></span>
                            <select class="form-select" id="handedness" name="handedness" required>
                                <option value="" disabled selected>Select...</option>
                                <option value="left">Left</option>
                                <option value="right">Right</option>
                            </select>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="username" class="form-label">Username</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-user"></i></span>
                            <input type="text" class="form-control" id="username" name="username" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="password" class="form-label">Password</label>
                        <div class="input-group">
                            <span class="input-group-text"><i class="fas fa-lock"></i></span>
                            <input type="password" class="form-control" id="password" name="password" required>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    <div class="d-grid gap-2">
                        <button type="submit" class="btn btn-success btn-lg">Register</button>
                    </div>
                </form>
                <hr>
                <div class="text-center">
                    <p>Already have an account? <a href="{{ url_for('login') }}" class="text-decoration-none">Login here</a></p>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}

app.py (Updated)

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for, flash, session
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = 'your_secret_key_here'  # Change this for production

# Configure SQLAlchemy to use an SQLite database called users.db
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///users.db'
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS'] = False

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

# Define a User model including the new fields
class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    first_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    last_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    birth_year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    handedness = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'<User {self.username}>'

# Create the database tables before the first request
@app.before_first_request
def create_tables():
    db.create_all()

# Updated registration route that saves all fields in the database
@app.route('/register', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        first_name = request.form['first_name']
        last_name = request.form['last_name']
        email = request.form['email']
        phone = request.form['phone']
        birth_year = request.form['birth_year']
        handedness = request.form['handedness']
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']

        # Check if username already exists
        if User.query.filter_by(username=username).first():
            flash('Username already exists', 'danger')
        else:
            new_user = User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                email=email,
                phone=phone,
                birth_year=birth_year,
                handedness=handedness,
                username=username,
                password=password
            )
            db.session.add(new_user)
            db.session.commit()
            flash('Registration successful! Please login.', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html')

@app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']
        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username, password=password).first()
        if user:
            session['username'] = user.username
            session['email'] = user.email
            flash('Login successful!', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('home'))
        else:
            flash('Invalid username or password', 'danger')
    return render_template('login.html')

@app.route('/')
def home():
    if 'username' in session:
        return render_template('landing_page.html')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

@app.route('/logout', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def logout():
    session.clear()
    flash('You have been logged out', 'info')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=5000, debug=True)

Explanation

  • register.html:
    The registration form now includes the following fields:

    • Name (first_name) – Text input

    • Surname (last_name) – Text input

    • Email – Email input

    • Phone – Number input

    • Year of Birth (birth_year) – Number input (acting as a simple calendar widget for years)

    • Handedness – Dropdown select with options "Left" and "Right"

    • Username and Password – As before
      All fields are marked as required.

  • app.py:

    • The User model now includes fields for first_name, last_name, phone, birth_year, and handedness.

    • The registration route extracts these fields from the form and creates a new user record in the SQLite database (users.db).

    • The rest of the code (login, home, logout) remains largely unchanged.

You can copy and paste these code blocks into your project. Let me know if you need any further modifications or additional features!

You said:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\app.py", line 29, in <module> @app.before_first_request ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ AttributeError: 'Flask' object has no attribute 'before_first_request'. Did you mean: '_got_first_request'? (venv) PS C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app>
ChatGPT said:

It looks like your Flask version (or environment) isn't recognizing the decorator. Instead of using the @app.before_first_request decorator, you can create your tables explicitly before running the app using the app context. Here’s the updated code for your app.py that does this:

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for, flash, session
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = 'your_secret_key_here'  # Change this for production

# Configure SQLAlchemy to use an SQLite database called users.db
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///users.db'
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS'] = False

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

# Define a User model including the new fields
class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    first_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    last_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    birth_year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    handedness = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'<User {self.username}>'

# Registration route that saves all fields in the database
@app.route('/register', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        first_name = request.form['first_name']
        last_name = request.form['last_name']
        email = request.form['email']
        phone = request.form['phone']
        birth_year = request.form['birth_year']
        handedness = request.form['handedness']
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']

        # Check if username already exists
        if User.query.filter_by(username=username).first():
            flash('Username already exists', 'danger')
        else:
            new_user = User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                email=email,
                phone=phone,
                birth_year=birth_year,
                handedness=handedness,
                username=username,
                password=password
            )
            db.session.add(new_user)
            db.session.commit()
            flash('Registration successful! Please login.', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html')

@app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']
        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username, password=password).first()
        if user:
            session['username'] = user.username
            session['email'] = user.email
            flash('Login successful!', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('home'))
        else:
            flash('Invalid username or password', 'danger')
    return render_template('login.html')

@app.route('/')
def home():
    if 'username' in session:
        return render_template('landing_page.html')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

@app.route('/logout', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def logout():
    session.clear()
    flash('You have been logged out', 'info')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Create the database tables explicitly before running the app
    with app.app_context():
        db.create_all()
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=5000, debug=True)

Explanation

  • Database Initialization:
    Instead of using @app.before_first_request, we open an application context with with app.app_context(): and then call db.create_all() before starting the server. This ensures the database tables are created properly.

  • Database File:
    The database is configured to be an SQLite file called users.db located in your project folder.

This adjustment should resolve the AttributeError. Let me know if you have any more questions!

ChatGPT said:

The error indicates that your login template is trying to build a URL for a route named forgot_password, but no such route is defined. To fix this, you need to add a forgot_password route. Below is the complete updated code for your app.py (including the registration, login, forgot password, home, and logout routes) and a simple forgot_password.html template.

Updated app.py

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for, flash, session
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = 'your_secret_key_here'  # Change this for production

# Configure SQLAlchemy to use an SQLite database called users.db
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///users.db'
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS'] = False

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

# Define the User model including the new fields
class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    first_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    last_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    birth_year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    handedness = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'<User {self.username}>'

# Registration route that saves all fields in the database
@app.route('/register', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        first_name = request.form['first_name']
        last_name = request.form['last_name']
        email = request.form['email']
        phone = request.form['phone']
        birth_year = request.form['birth_year']
        handedness = request.form['handedness']
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']

        # Check if username already exists
        if User.query.filter_by(username=username).first():
            flash('Username already exists', 'danger')
        else:
            new_user = User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                email=email,
                phone=phone,
                birth_year=birth_year,
                handedness=handedness,
                username=username,
                password=password
            )
            db.session.add(new_user)
            db.session.commit()
            flash('Registration successful! Please login.', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html')

# Login route
@app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']
        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username, password=password).first()
        if user:
            session['username'] = user.username
            session['email'] = user.email
            flash('Login successful!', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('home'))
        else:
            flash('Invalid username or password', 'danger')
    return render_template('login.html')

# Forgot Password route (added to resolve the BuildError)
@app.route('/forgot-password', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def forgot_password():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        email = request.form['email']
        # In a production app, implement password reset functionality here.
        flash('If an account exists with that email, a password reset link has been sent.', 'info')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('forgot_password.html')

# Home route
@app.route('/')
def home():
    if 'username' in session:
        return render_template('landing_page.html')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

# Logout route
@app.route('/logout', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def logout():
    session.clear()
    flash('You have been logged out', 'info')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Create the database tables explicitly before running the app
    with app.app_context():
        db.create_all()
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=5000, debug=True)

Minimal forgot_password.html Template

Create a new file named forgot_password.html in your templates folder with the following content:

html
{% extends "base.html" %}
{% block title %}Forgot Password{% endblock %}
{% block content %}
<div class="row justify-content-center">
    <div class="col-md-6 col-lg-4">
        <div class="card mt-5">
            <div class="card-header bg-info text-white">
                <h3 class="text-center">Forgot Password</h3>
            </div>
            <div class="card-body">
                <form method="POST" action="{{ url_for('forgot_password') }}">
                    <div class="mb-3">
                        <label for="email" class="form-label">Enter your email</label>
                        <input type="email" class="form-control" id="email" name="email" required>
                    </div>
                    <div class="d-grid gap-2">
                        <button type="submit" class="btn btn-info btn-lg">Submit</button>
                    </div>
                </form>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}

Explanation

  • Forgot Password Route:
    The route /forgot-password is added to handle GET and POST requests. On POST, it flashes a message (simulating a password reset link being sent) and redirects to the login page.

  • Template Update:
    The forgot_password.html template provides a simple form for users to enter their email address. This resolves the BuildError when the login template calls url_for('forgot_password').

Copy and paste these files into your project. This should resolve the BuildError and integrate the forgot password functionality. Let me know if you have any more questions!

ChatGPT said:

The error is occurring because your template is trying to generate a URL for a route named "profile," but no such route is defined in your Flask app. To fix this, you need to add a profile route. Below is the updated code for your app.py with the new profile route, and a minimal example of a profile_page.html template.

Updated app.py

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for, flash, session
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = 'your_secret_key_here'  # Change this for production

# Configure SQLAlchemy to use an SQLite database called users.db
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///users.db'
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS'] = False

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

# Define the User model including the new fields
class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    first_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    last_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    birth_year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    handedness = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'<User {self.username}>'

# Registration route that saves all fields in the database
@app.route('/register', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        first_name = request.form['first_name']
        last_name = request.form['last_name']
        email = request.form['email']
        phone = request.form['phone']
        birth_year = request.form['birth_year']
        handedness = request.form['handedness']
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']

        # Check if username already exists
        if User.query.filter_by(username=username).first():
            flash('Username already exists', 'danger')
        else:
            new_user = User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                email=email,
                phone=phone,
                birth_year=birth_year,
                handedness=handedness,
                username=username,
                password=password
            )
            db.session.add(new_user)
            db.session.commit()
            flash('Registration successful! Please login.', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html')

# Login route
@app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']
        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username, password=password).first()
        if user:
            session['username'] = user.username
            session['email'] = user.email
            flash('Login successful!', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('home'))
        else:
            flash('Invalid username or password', 'danger')
    return render_template('login.html')

# Forgot Password route
@app.route('/forgot-password', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def forgot_password():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        email = request.form['email']
        # In a production app, implement password reset functionality here.
        flash('If an account exists with that email, a password reset link has been sent.', 'info')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('forgot_password.html')

# Home route
@app.route('/')
def home():
    if 'username' in session:
        return render_template('landing_page.html')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

# Profile route (added to resolve the BuildError)
@app.route('/profile')
def profile():
    if 'username' not in session:
        flash('Please login to view your profile', 'warning')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    user = User.query.filter_by(username=session['username']).first()
    if user:
        return render_template('profile_page.html', user=user)
    else:
        flash('User not found', 'danger')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))

# Logout route
@app.route('/logout', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def logout():
    session.clear()
    flash('You have been logged out', 'info')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    # Create the database tables explicitly before running the app
    with app.app_context():
        db.create_all()
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=5000, debug=True)

Minimal profile_page.html Template

Create a new file named profile_page.html in your templates folder with the following content:

html
{% extends "base.html" %}
{% block title %}User Profile{% endblock %}
{% block content %}
<div class="container mt-5">
    <div class="row justify-content-center">
        <div class="col-md-8">
            <div class="card shadow">
                <div class="card-header bg-primary text-white">
                    <h3>User Profile</h3>
                </div>
                <div class="card-body">
                    <p><strong>Name:</strong> {{ user.first_name }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Surname:</strong> {{ user.last_name }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Username:</strong> {{ user.username }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Email:</strong> {{ user.email }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Phone:</strong> {{ user.phone }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Year of Birth:</strong> {{ user.birth_year }}</p>
                    <p><strong>Handedness:</strong> {{ user.handedness }}</p>
                    <a href="{{ url_for('home') }}" class="btn btn-secondary">Back to Home</a>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}

Explanation

  • Profile Route:
    The new /profile route checks if a user is logged in (by verifying the session) and retrieves the user information from the database. It then renders profile_page.html, passing the user data to the template.

  • Template Link:
    The landing page (or any other page) that includes <a href="{{ url_for('profile') }}"> will now work because the endpoint profile is defined.

Copy these updated files into your project. This should resolve the BuildError, and your profile page will now be accessible after login. Let me know if you have any more questions!

You said:
this is what i get when I click on my username in the landing_page.html: BuildError werkzeug.routing.exceptions.BuildError: Could not build url for endpoint 'update_profile'. Did you mean 'profile' instead? Traceback (most recent call last) File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1536, in __call__ return self.wsgi_app(environ, start_response) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1514, in wsgi_app response = self.handle_exception(e) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1511, in wsgi_app response = self.full_dispatch_request() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 919, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.handle_user_exception(e) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 917, in full_dispatch_request rv = self.dispatch_request() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 902, in dispatch_request return self.ensure_sync(self.view_functions[rule.endpoint])(**view_args) # type: ignore[no-any-return] ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\app.py", line 102, in profile return render_template('profile_page.html', user=user) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\templating.py", line 150, in render_template return _render(app, template, context) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\templating.py", line 131, in _render rv = template.render(context) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\jinja2\environment.py", line 1295, in render self.environment.handle_exception() ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\jinja2\environment.py", line 942, in handle_exception raise rewrite_traceback_stack(source=source) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\templates\profile_page.html", line 1, in top-level template code {% extends "base.html" %} File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\templates\base.html", line 24, in top-level template code {% block content %}{% endblock %} File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\templates\profile_page.html", line 15, in block 'content' <form method="POST" action="{{ url_for('update_profile') }}"> File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1121, in url_for return self.handle_url_build_error(error, endpoint, values) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\flask\app.py", line 1110, in url_for rv = url_adapter.build( # type: ignore[union-attr] File "C:\Users\tmarkac\Python_projects\Tennis_app\venv\Lib\site-packages\werkzeug\routing\map.py", line 924, in build raise BuildError(endpoint, values, method, self) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ werkzeug.routing.exceptions.BuildError: Could not build url for endpoint 'update_profile'. Did you mean 'profile' instead? The debugger caught an exception in your WSGI application. You can now look at the traceback which led to the error. To switch between the interactive traceback and the plaintext one, you can click on the "Traceback" headline. From the text traceback you can also create a paste of it. Brought to you by DON'T PANIC, your friendly Werkzeug powered traceback interpreter.
ChatGPT said:

The error is occurring because your template (in profile_page.html) is trying to build a URL for an endpoint named update_profile, but no route with that endpoint is defined. To fix this, you need to add an update_profile route to your app.

Below is the updated complete code for your app.py including the update_profile route:

python
from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for, flash, session
from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy

app = Flask(__name__)
app.secret_key = 'your_secret_key_here'  # Change this for production

# Configure SQLAlchemy to use an SQLite database called users.db
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_DATABASE_URI'] = 'sqlite:///users.db'
app.config['SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS'] = False

db = SQLAlchemy(app)

# Define the User model including the new fields
class User(db.Model):
    id = db.Column(db.Integer, primary_key=True)
    first_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    last_name = db.Column(db.String(80), nullable=False)
    username = db.Column(db.String(80), unique=True, nullable=False)
    password = db.Column(db.String(120), nullable=False)
    email = db.Column(db.String(120), unique=True, nullable=False)
    phone = db.Column(db.String(20), nullable=False)
    birth_year = db.Column(db.Integer, nullable=False)
    handedness = db.Column(db.String(10), nullable=False)

    def __repr__(self):
        return f'<User {self.username}>'

# Registration route that saves all fields in the database
@app.route('/register', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def register():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        first_name = request.form['first_name']
        last_name = request.form['last_name']
        email = request.form['email']
        phone = request.form['phone']
        birth_year = request.form['birth_year']
        handedness = request.form['handedness']
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']

        # Check if username already exists
        if User.query.filter_by(username=username).first():
            flash('Username already exists', 'danger')
        else:
            new_user = User(
                first_name=first_name,
                last_name=last_name,
                email=email,
                phone=phone,
                birth_year=birth_year,
                handedness=handedness,
                username=username,
                password=password
            )
            db.session.add(new_user)
            db.session.commit()
            flash('Registration successful! Please login.', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('register.html')

# Login route
@app.route('/login', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def login():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        username = request.form['username']
        password = request.form['password']
        user = User.query.filter_by(username=username, password=password).first()
        if user:
            session['username'] = user.username
            session['email'] = user.email
            flash('Login successful!', 'success')
            return redirect(url_for('home'))
        else:
            flash('Invalid username or password', 'danger')
    return render_template('login.html')

# Forgot Password route
@app.route('/forgot-password', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def forgot_password():
    if request.method == 'POST':
        email = request.form['email']
        # Implement password reset functionality here in production
        flash('If an account exists with that email, a password reset link has been sent.', 'info')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    return render_template('forgot_password.html')

# Home route
@app.route('/')
def home():
    if 'username' in session:
        return render_template('landing_page.html')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

# Profile route to display user information
@app.route('/profile')
def profile():
    if 'username' not in session:
        flash('Please login to view your profile', 'warning')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    user = User.query.filter_by(username=session['username']).first()
    if user:
        return render_template('profile_page.html', user=user)
    else:
        flash('User not found', 'danger')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))

# Update Profile route to handle profile updates
@app.route('/update-profile', methods=['POST'])
def update_profile():
    if 'username' not in session:
        flash('Please login to update your profile', 'warning')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    user = User.query.filter_by(username=session['username']).first()
    if user:
        # Update user profile fields from the form data
        user.first_name = request.form.get('first_name', user.first_name)
        user.last_name = request.form.get('last_name', user.last_name)
        user.email = request.form.get('email', user.email)
        user.phone = request.form.get('phone', user.phone)
        user.birth_year = request.form.get('birth_year', user.birth_year)
        user.handedness = request.form.get('handedness', user.handedness)
        db.session.commit()
        flash('Profile updated successfully!', 'success')
    else:
        flash('User not found', 'danger')
    return redirect(url_for('profile'))

# Logout route
@app.route('/logout', methods=['GET', 'POST'])
def logout():
    session.clear()
    flash('You have been logged out', 'info')
    return redirect(url_for('login'))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    with app.app_context():
        db.create_all()
    app.run(host='0.0.0.0', port=5000, debug=True)

Explanation

  • Update Profile Route:

    • The new @app.route('/update-profile', methods=['POST']) route handles POST requests from the profile update form in your profile_page.html.

    • It checks that the user is logged in, retrieves the user from the database, updates the profile fields, commits the changes, and then redirects back to the profile page.

  • Template Usage:

    • In your profile_page.html, the form should have its action set to {{ url_for('update_profile') }}, which now correctly maps to the new route.

This update should resolve the BuildError you're seeing. Let me know if you have any more questions or need further assistance!

You said:
change the profile.html so it contains all the data that it currently has plus the missing data from the registration form
ChatGPT said:

Below is the updated profile_page.html template that displays all the data currently shown plus the additional fields (Name and Surname) from the registration form. This version includes a form for updating the user's profile, with all required fields:

html
{% extends "base.html" %}
{% block title %}User Profile{% endblock %}
{% block content %}
<div class="container mt-5">
  <div class="row justify-content-center">
    <div class="col-md-10">
      <div class="card shadow">
        <div class="card-header bg-primary text-white">
          <h3>User Profile</h3>
        </div>
        <div class="card-body">
          <!-- Form posts to update_profile endpoint -->
          <form method="POST" action="{{ url_for('update_profile') }}">
            <div class="row mb-4">
              <div class="col-md-4 text-center">
                <div class="profile-image mb-3">
                  <i class="fas fa-user-circle fa-5x text-secondary"></i>
                </div>
                <h4 class="fw-bold">{{ user.username }}</h4>
              </div>
              <div class="col-md-8">
                <h5>Account Information</h5>
                <hr>
                <!-- First Name -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="first_name" class="form-label">Name</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="first_name" name="first_name"
                           value="{{ user.first_name }}" required>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Last Name -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="last_name" class="form-label">Surname</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="last_name" name="last_name"
                           value="{{ user.last_name }}" required>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Email -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="email" class="form-label">Email</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="email" class="form-control" id="email" name="email"
                           value="{{ user.email }}" required>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Phone -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="phone" class="form-label">Phone</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="number" class="form-control" id="phone" name="phone"
                           value="{{ user.phone }}" required>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Win Ratio (readonly) -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="win_ratio" class="form-label">Win Ratio</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="win_ratio" name="win_ratio"
                           value="{{ user.win_ratio }}" readonly placeholder="Will be calculated">
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Weight -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="weight" class="form-label">Weight (kg)</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="number" class="form-control" id="weight" name="weight"
                           value="{{ user.weight }}" min="30" max="200" step="1">
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Height -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="height" class="form-label">Height (cm)</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="number" class="form-control" id="height" name="height"
                           value="{{ user.height }}" min="100" max="250" step="1">
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Year of Birth -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="birth_year" class="form-label">Year of Birth</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <input type="number" class="form-control" id="birth_year" name="birth_year"
                           value="{{ user.birth_year }}" min="1900" max="2023" step="1" required>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Handedness -->
                <div class="row mb-2 align-items-center">
                  <div class="col-sm-3">
                    <label for="handedness" class="form-label">Handedness</label>
                  </div>
                  <div class="col-sm-9">
                    <select class="form-select" id="handedness" name="handedness" required>
                      <option value="" disabled>Select...</option>
                      <option value="left" {% if user.handedness == 'left' %}selected{% endif %}>Left</option>
                      <option value="right" {% if user.handedness == 'right' %}selected{% endif %}>Right</option>
                    </select>
                  </div>
                </div>
                <!-- Action Buttons -->
                <div class="row mt-4">
                  <div class="col d-flex justify-content-center gap-3">
                    <a href="{{ url_for('home') }}" class="btn btn-secondary">Back to Home</a>
                    <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary">Save Changes</button>
                  </div>
                </div>
              </div>
            </div>
          </form>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>
{% endblock %}

Explanation

  • New Fields Added:
    The form now includes rows for both Name (first_name) and Surname (last_name) at the top, which were missing before.

  • Other Fields Retained:
    All the previously existing fields such as Email, Phone, Year of Birth, Handedness, and extra fields like Win Ratio (readonly), Weight, and Height remain in place.

  • Form Action:
    The form posts to the update_profile endpoint, which should be defined in your app.py to process and update these profile details.

You can copy and paste this code into your profile_page.html file to update your profile view accordingly. Let me know if you need further modifications!

You said:
header container is to high. shrink it. Also menu length is to big. It should be little bigger then the last option in the menu
ChatGPT said:

Below is an updated CSS snippet that you can use to reduce the header height and adjust the left-hand side menu so that it only takes up the space needed by its options:

css
/* HEADER: Fixed top container with clay court background */
.header-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 100px; /* Reduced from 150px */
  background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80') no-repeat center center/cover;
  color: #fff;
  z-index: 1050;
}
.header-container::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35);
  z-index: 0;
}
.header-title {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
  text-align: center;
  line-height: 100px; /* Updated to match header height */
  font-size: 2rem; /* Optionally reduced from 2.5rem */
  font-weight: bold;
  margin: 0;
}

/* LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU: Fixed menu starting below the header */
.left-menu {
  position: fixed;
  top: 100px; /* Updated to match the new header height */
  left: 0;
  width: 250px;
  /* Removed bottom: 0 so the menu only takes as much space as needed */
  background-color: #343a40;
  padding: 1rem;
  overflow-y: auto;
  z-index: 1040;
}
.left-menu a {
  display: block;
  color: #fff;
  text-decoration: none;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.left-menu a:hover {
  background-color: #495057;
}

What Changed:

  • Header Container:

    • The height is now set to 100px instead of 150px.

    • The .header-title line-height is updated to 100px to vertically center the text, and the font-size is slightly reduced.

  • Left Menu:

    • The top property is updated to 100px to start just below the header.

    • Removed bottom: 0 so that the menu’s height is determined by its content rather than stretching the full height of the viewport.

Simply replace the corresponding CSS in your project with this updated code. Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
return complete css file so I can copy paste
ChatGPT said:

Below is a complete CSS file that incorporates the updated header and left menu styling (with a reduced header height and a left menu that only occupies as much height as its content):

css
/* ===== HEADER STYLES ===== */
.header-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 100px; /* Reduced header height */
  background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80')
              no-repeat center center/cover;
  color: #fff;
  z-index: 1050;
}
.header-container::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35);
  z-index: 0;
}
.header-title {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
  text-align: center;
  line-height: 100px; /* Match header height */
  font-size: 2rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  margin: 0;
}

/* ===== LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU ===== */
.left-menu {
  position: fixed;
  top: 100px; /* Starts just below the header */
  left: 0;
  width: 250px;
  background-color: #343a40;
  padding: 1rem;
  overflow-y: auto;
  z-index: 1040;
  /* No bottom property: the menu's height is defined by its content */
}
.left-menu a {
  display: block;
  color: #fff;
  text-decoration: none;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.left-menu a:hover {
  background-color: #495057;
}

/* ===== MAIN CONTENT ===== */
.main-content {
  margin-top: 100px; /* Space below the header */
  margin-left: 250px; /* Space for the left menu */
  padding: 1rem;
}

/* ===== FLASH MESSAGES ===== */
.alert {
  margin-top: 1rem;
}

/* ===== RESPONSIVE STYLES ===== */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .header-container {
    height: 80px;
  }
  .header-title {
    line-height: 80px;
    font-size: 1.8rem;
  }
  .left-menu {
    top: 80px;
    width: 200px;
  }
  .main-content {
    margin-top: 80px;
    margin-left: 200px;
  }
}

You can copy and paste this complete CSS file into your project's stylesheet. Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
nothing changed on the landing page. And push notifications regarding successful login and log out should only appear on relevant pages not on all(profile.html for instance) and they should dissapera after 4 seconds
ChatGPT said:

Below is the complete updated CSS file along with an updated version of your base.html. These changes will:

  • Reduce the header height and shrink the left-hand side menu so it only takes up as much space as its content.

  • Ensure that flash (push) notifications auto-hide after 4 seconds.

  • Allow you to control which pages display flash notifications via a flag (for example, you can hide them on the profile page).

Complete CSS File (static/css/style.css)

css
/* ===== HEADER STYLES ===== */
.header-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 100px; /* Reduced header height */
  background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80')
              no-repeat center center/cover;
  color: #fff;
  z-index: 1050;
}
.header-container::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35);
  z-index: 0;
}
.header-title {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
  text-align: center;
  line-height: 100px; /* Match header height */
  font-size: 2rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  margin: 0;
}

/* ===== LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU ===== */
.left-menu {
  position: fixed;
  top: 100px; /* Starts just below the header */
  left: 0;
  width: 250px;
  background-color: #343a40;
  padding: 1rem;
  overflow-y: auto;
  z-index: 1040;
  /* No bottom property so height is defined by content */
}
.left-menu a {
  display: block;
  color: #fff;
  text-decoration: none;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.left-menu a:hover {
  background-color: #495057;
}

/* ===== MAIN CONTENT ===== */
.main-content {
  margin-top: 100px; /* space below header */
  margin-left: 250px; /* space for left menu */
  padding: 1rem;
}

/* ===== FLASH MESSAGES ===== */
.alert {
  margin-top: 1rem;
}

/* ===== RESPONSIVE STYLES ===== */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .header-container {
    height: 80px;
  }
  .header-title {
    line-height: 80px;
    font-size: 1.8rem;
  }
  .left-menu {
    top: 80px;
    width: 200px;
  }
  .main-content {
    margin-top: 80px;
    margin-left: 200px;
  }
}

Updated Base Template (templates/base.html)

Replace your current base.html with the following code. Notice the new conditional for displaying flash messages and a JavaScript snippet that auto-hides them after 4 seconds.

html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
  <title>Tennis App - {% block title %}{% endblock %}</title>
  <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.0/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.0.0/css/all.min.css">
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}">
</head>
<body>
  <div class="container-fluid tennis-app-container">
    {# Render flash messages only if hide_flashes is not set or is false #}
    {% if not hide_flashes %}
      {% with messages = get_flashed_messages(with_categories=true) %}
        {% if messages %}
          {% for category, message in messages %}
            <div class="alert alert-{{ category }} alert-dismissible fade show" role="alert">
              {{ message }}
              <button type="button" class="btn-close" data-bs-dismiss="alert" aria-label="Close"></button>
            </div>
          {% endfor %}
        {% endif %}
      {% endwith %}
    {% endif %}
    
    {% block content %}{% endblock %}
  </div>
  
  <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.0/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script>
  <script>
    // Auto-hide flash messages after 4 seconds
    window.setTimeout(function() {
      var alerts = document.querySelectorAll('.alert');
      alerts.forEach(function(alert) {
        alert.style.transition = 'opacity 0.5s ease-out';
        alert.style.opacity = '0';
        setTimeout(function() {
          alert.remove();
        }, 500);
      });
    }, 4000);
  </script>
</body>
</html>

How to Control Flash Notifications on Specific Pages

Flash notifications (for example, "Login successful" or "You have been logged out") will now be rendered only if the template does not set a variable named hide_flashes.

For example, in your profile route in app.py, update the render call like this:

python
@app.route('/profile')
def profile():
    if 'username' not in session:
        flash('Please login to view your profile', 'warning')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))
    user = User.query.filter_by(username=session['username']).first()
    if user:
        # Hide flash messages on the profile page by setting hide_flashes=True
        return render_template('profile_page.html', user=user, hide_flashes=True)
    else:
        flash('User not found', 'danger')
        return redirect(url_for('login'))

This way, flash messages triggered during login or logout will only appear on those pages (or any page where you do not set hide_flashes=True), and they will automatically fade out after 4 seconds.

Copy and paste the provided CSS file and base.html into your project. Then update your Flask routes (such as the profile route) to pass hide_flashes=True where you do not want flash notifications to appear. This should address both issues. Let me know if you need further assistance!

You said:
push notifications look ok but my landing page is unchanged....header container is to high and menu on the right side is to wide
ChatGPT said:

Below is a complete CSS file with updated values that should reduce the header container height and shrink the left-hand side menu to better fit the menu items. Please copy and paste the following into your project's CSS file (for example, static/css/style.css):

css
/* ===== HEADER STYLES ===== */
.header-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 80px; /* Reduced header height */
  background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80')
              no-repeat center center/cover;
  color: #fff;
  z-index: 1050;
}
.header-container::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35);
  z-index: 0;
}
.header-title {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
  text-align: center;
  line-height: 80px; /* Adjust to match header height */
  font-size: 1.8rem; /* Slightly reduced font size */
  font-weight: bold;
  margin: 0;
}

/* ===== LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU ===== */
.left-menu {
  position: fixed;
  top: 80px; /* Starts just below the header */
  left: 0;
  width: 180px; /* Reduced menu width */
  background-color: #343a40;
  padding: 1rem;
  overflow-y: auto;
  z-index: 1040;
  /* Height will adjust based on content */
}
.left-menu a {
  display: block;
  color: #fff;
  text-decoration: none;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.left-menu a:hover {
  background-color: #495057;
}

/* ===== MAIN CONTENT ===== */
.main-content {
  margin-top: 80px; /* Space below header */
  margin-left: 180px; /* Space for the left menu */
  padding: 1rem;
}

/* ===== FLASH MESSAGES ===== */
.alert {
  margin-top: 1rem;
}

/* ===== RESPONSIVE STYLES ===== */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .header-container {
    height: 60px;
  }
  .header-title {
    line-height: 60px;
    font-size: 1.5rem;
  }
  .left-menu {
    top: 60px;
    width: 150px;
  }
  .main-content {
    margin-top: 60px;
    margin-left: 150px;
  }
}

Note:
• Make sure your landing page is linking to this CSS file (e.g., via <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}"> in your base.html).
• If you still see no changes, try clearing your browser cache to force a reload of the updated stylesheet.

This should shrink both the header container and the left menu so that the menu's width closely matches the content of your menu options. Let me know if you need further adjustments!

You said:
no changes, why is this so
ChatGPT said:

If nothing is changing on your landing page, here are some common reasons and steps to troubleshoot:

  1. Browser Cache:
    Your browser might be caching the old CSS file. Try doing a hard refresh (e.g., Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows or Cmd+Shift+R on macOS) or clear your browser cache.

  2. File Path/Link Issues:
    Verify that your base.html is correctly linking to your updated CSS file. For example, make sure you have something like:

    html
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}">

    in your <head> section and that the file path matches where your CSS file is actually stored.

  3. CSS Specificity or Overriding:
    There might be other CSS (inline or in other files) overriding these styles. Check if there’s any inline style or another stylesheet loaded after your custom CSS.

  4. Server Restart:
    If you’re running a development server, sometimes a restart of your Flask server can help ensure the changes are picked up.

Double-check these points. If the problem persists, try opening your browser's developer tools (F12) to inspect the elements and see which CSS rules are actually applied and if your updated styles appear in the Sources or Network tab.

Let me know if you need further assistance after checking these points!

You said:
this is my css
ChatGPT said:

If nothing seems to change, it's often a caching or linking issue. Here are some steps to troubleshoot and ensure your updated CSS is loaded:

  1. Force a Hard Refresh:
    Try doing a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows or Cmd+Shift+R on macOS) to clear the browser cache. Browsers sometimes cache CSS files, so your updates might not be reloaded immediately.

  2. Version Your CSS File:
    Add a query parameter to your CSS link in base.html to force the browser to load the latest version. For example, update your link tag to:

    html
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}?v=2">

    This tells the browser it's a new file version.

  3. Check the File Path:
    Make sure that your base.html is correctly linking to the right CSS file. Confirm that your file is located at static/css/style.css and that the link tag in your <head> is correct.

  4. Developer Tools:
    Open your browser's developer tools (F12) and check the Network tab to see if the correct CSS file is being loaded. Also inspect the elements (using the Elements tab) to verify which CSS rules are being applied. This can help identify if other styles are overriding your changes.

  5. Ensure No Overrides:
    Double-check that there are no inline styles or additional CSS files being loaded that could override your custom styles.

If you've confirmed these points and you still see no changes, please paste the contents of your CSS file here so I can review it further.

You said:
this is my css: /* ===== HEADER STYLES ===== */ .header-container { position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; right: 0; height: 80px; /* Reduced header height */ background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80') no-repeat center center/cover; color: #fff; z-index: 1050; } .header-container::before { content: ""; position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; right: 0; bottom: 0; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35); z-index: 0; } .header-title { position: relative; z-index: 1; text-align: center; line-height: 80px; /* Adjust to match header height */ font-size: 1.8rem; /* Slightly reduced font size */ font-weight: bold; margin: 0; } /* ===== LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU ===== */ .left-menu { position: fixed; top: 80px; /* Starts just below the header */ left: 0; width: 180px; /* Reduced menu width */ background-color: #343a40; padding: 1rem; overflow-y: auto; z-index: 1040; /* Height will adjust based on content */ } .left-menu a { display: block; color: #fff; text-decoration: none; margin: 0.5rem 0; padding: 0.5rem; border-radius: 5px; } .left-menu a:hover { background-color: #495057; } /* ===== MAIN CONTENT ===== */ .main-content { margin-top: 80px; /* Space below header */ margin-left: 180px; /* Space for the left menu */ padding: 1rem; } /* ===== FLASH MESSAGES ===== */ .alert { margin-top: 1rem; } /* ===== RESPONSIVE STYLES ===== */ @media (max-width: 768px) { .header-container { height: 60px; } .header-title { line-height: 60px; font-size: 1.5rem; } .left-menu { top: 60px; width: 150px; } .main-content { margin-top: 60px; margin-left: 150px; } } is it good?
ChatGPT said:

Your CSS looks syntactically correct and should reduce the header height to 80px and set the left menu width to 180px, with corresponding adjustments for the main content. Here’s a quick review:

  • Header:
    The header is set to 80px tall, with a matching line-height in the .header-title (80px), and a reduced font size (1.8rem).

  • Left Menu:
    The left menu is set to 180px wide and starts just below the header (top: 80px). Its width and padding should ensure it only occupies as much space as needed by its content.

  • Main Content:
    The .main-content margin-left is set to 180px, so it should align with the left menu.

  • Responsive Styles:
    The media query reduces the header to 60px and the left menu to 150px on screens below 768px, which is also good.

If you’re not seeing any changes on your landing page, here are a few troubleshooting tips:

  1. Clear Browser Cache:
    Hard-refresh your page (Ctrl+Shift+R or Cmd+Shift+R) to ensure the updated CSS is loaded.

  2. Verify File Linking:
    Check that your base.html is linking to the correct CSS file. For example:

    html
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}?v=1">

    Adding a query parameter (like ?v=1) can help force the browser to fetch the latest version.

  3. Inspect with Developer Tools:
    Use your browser’s Developer Tools (F12) to inspect the header and menu elements. This can help you see if the styles are being applied or if there are any conflicting rules.

In summary, your CSS code is good. If the changes are not reflecting, it’s likely a caching or linking issue rather than a problem with the CSS itself.

document.querySelectorAll('.alert'); alerts.forEach(function(alert) { alert.style.transition = 'opacity 0.5s ease-out'; alert.style.opacity = '0'; setTimeout(function() { alert.remove(); }, 500); }); }, 5000); </script> </div> the element where it says Main landing content should start where the left menu finishes, they should not overlap
ChatGPT said:

Below is a revised complete CSS file that:

  • Sets a global box-sizing rule so that padding doesn’t add extra width.

  • Ensures that the left-hand side menu’s total width remains at 180px.

  • Keeps the main content starting exactly after the left menu (with margin-left: 180px).

Please copy and paste the following into your CSS file (e.g., static/css/style.css):

css
/* Global box-sizing to include padding in width calculations */
* {
  box-sizing: border-box;
}

/* ===== HEADER STYLES ===== */
.header-container {
  position: fixed;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  height: 80px; /* Reduced header height */
  background: url('https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1605875200273-a63d6a51f9e1?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1600&q=80')
              no-repeat center center/cover;
  color: #fff;
  z-index: 1050;
}
.header-container::before {
  content: "";
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
  right: 0;
  bottom: 0;
  background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.35);
  z-index: 0;
}
.header-title {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 1;
  text-align: center;
  line-height: 80px; /* Match header height */
  font-size: 1.8rem;
  font-weight: bold;
  margin: 0;
}

/* ===== LEFT-HAND SIDE MENU ===== */
.left-menu {
  position: fixed;
  top: 80px; /* Starts just below the header */
  left: 0;
  width: 180px; /* Reduced menu width */
  background-color: #343a40;
  padding: 1rem;
  overflow-y: auto;
  z-index: 1040;
}
.left-menu a {
  display: block;
  color: #fff;
  text-decoration: none;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  padding: 0.5rem;
  border-radius: 5px;
}
.left-menu a:hover {
  background-color: #495057;
}

/* ===== MAIN CONTENT ===== */
.main-content {
  margin-top: 80px;  /* Space below header */
  margin-left: 180px; /* Exactly the width of the left menu */
  padding: 1rem;
}

/* ===== FLASH MESSAGES ===== */
.alert {
  margin-top: 1rem;
}

/* ===== RESPONSIVE STYLES ===== */
@media (max-width: 768px) {
  .header-container {
    height: 60px;
  }
  .header-title {
    line-height: 60px;
    font-size: 1.5rem;
  }
  .left-menu {
    top: 60px;
    width: 150px;
  }
  .main-content {
    margin-top: 60px;
    margin-left: 150px;
  }
}

Troubleshooting Tips

  • Clear Cache:
    If you still see overlapping issues, try a hard refresh (Ctrl+Shift+R / Cmd+Shift+R) or clear your browser cache.

  • Verify Link:
    Make sure your base template is linking to this CSS file. For example:

    html
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}?v=1">

This file should ensure that the left-hand side menu ends at 180px, and the main content starts exactly after that without overlapping. Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

You said:
my base template: <!DOCTYPE html> <html lang="en"> <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>Tennis App - {% block title %}{% endblock %}</title> <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.0/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/font-awesome/6.0.0/css/all.min.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ url_for('static', filename='css/style.css') }}"> </head> <body> <div class="container-fluid tennis-app-container"> {# Render flash messages only if hide_flashes is not set or is false #} {% if not hide_flashes %} {% with messages = get_flashed_messages(with_categories=true) %} {% if messages %} {% for category, message in messages %} <div class="alert alert-{{ category }} alert-dismissible fade show" role="alert"> {{ message }} <button type="button" class="btn-close" data-bs-dismiss="alert" aria-label="Close"></button> </div> {% endfor %} {% endif %} {% endwith %} {% endif %} {% block content %}{% endblock %} </div> <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/bootstrap@5.3.0/dist/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js"></script> <script> // Auto-hide flash messages after 4 seconds window.setTimeout(function() { var alerts = document.querySelectorAll('.alert'); alerts.forEach(function(alert) { alert.style.transition = 'opacity 0.5s ease-out'; alert.style.opacity = '0'; setTimeout(function() { alert.remove(); }, 500); }); }, 4000); </script> </body> </html> is it ok?
ChatGPT said:

Yes, your base template looks good. It correctly:

  • Loads Bootstrap and Font Awesome via CDN.

  • Links your custom CSS file using url_for().

  • Includes a block for flash messages with a condition to hide them when desired.

  • Has a {% block content %} for page-specific content.

  • Includes JavaScript that auto-hides flash messages after 4 seconds.

If you encounter issues with layout changes, consider verifying that your custom CSS file is being loaded (e.g., by checking the network tab in your browser's developer tools) and performing a hard refresh. Otherwise, everything seems in order.

You said:
if i use incognito mode do I need to clear the cache?
ChatGPT said:

In incognito mode, browsers typically start with a fresh cache for each session, so you usually don't need to clear the cache. However, if you notice that outdated files are still being loaded, you might need to do a hard refresh within that incognito window.

can you interpret screenshots?
ChatGPT said:

��w�8^���[)J��U��W�x�b���~-6(�!K�������_׽?�|������c���b��=콏c��G��;wn�.�㮸=�^��Ĩ�i�o� �[>n�c$�#�h�Ϻ�=c���?��߳\����[�جۮ(ޏ����������-{�_���b+} ��_l8å��U�_��/�c=�����/�+�5�˟։_��宋�Un�_���1� ;��J>��Ax��:��8�*^g�Æ~��4�?�X<n��7�r�s,g��bW7P&^C�%���J�Y�e���N���ڌ}_�}�� Ā>�x��\���aò�|{F}Oc���q�e��j1��s)^k�قug�V���0�?P�=V�����8��g�b�\��ؿ培�ܣ�<��uܟ��/��sc%��q�?$���G�;P����}�?����_c�o�1B���.o�Z�@�خ�{��@���T�?Ƒ$I�ng��$IZ���� �4N�I�$I˝��$I�$IːA����"I�$i�3��$I�$i2��89^$I�$-w��$I�$-Cy'ǋ$I�����W�$I��e� O��x�$I����J�$I�� =z�v������1jo�I�$I˝��$I�$I��?��?���~;������ŀ�7ި|�ڗ�E�$I�Jd�+I�$I�-��ǯ~�����9^$I�$�T��$I�$I�$I���3��$I�$I�$I��5���$I�$I�$I�$�� ~%I�$I�$I�$i�g�+I�$I�$I�$Ik<�_I�$I�$I�$IZ��J�$I�$I�$I���W�$I�$I�$I��x��$I�$I�$I���3��$I�$I�$I��5���$I�$I�$I�$�� ~%I�$I�$I�$i�g�+I�$I�$I�$Ik<�_I�$I�$I�$IZ��J�$I�$I�$I���W�$I�$I�$I��x��$I�$I�$I���3��$I�$I�$I��5���$I�$I�$I�$�� ~%I�$I�$I�$i�g�+I�$I�$I�$Ik<�_I�$I�$I�$IZ��J�$I�$I�$I���W�$I�$I�$I��x��$I�$I�$I���3��$I�$I�$I��5���$I�$I�$I�$�� ~%I�$I�$I�$i�w׽��$IM␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀���WR+␀␀␀␀␀h2�_I�␀␀␀␀␀�� ~%�"␀␀␀␀␀�&3��Ԋ␀␀␀␀␀␀��Ń�Gӳ/O��k)M�Zu�-��c��͔.�^}��U␀␀␀␀␀��Va�'���=[�͹t�����7U<n����t�fw3 ~��␀␀␀␀␀�d�v���/N�+�^?��{ۃ[Ӯ�^Js�s���� ��}y2]Ϟ~p�#??�v�[��<F�j␀␀␀␀␀�d�x��4�=a��iS�w�3�-ݾJU~��1��Ky��U␀␀␀␀␀��n��7���=1x�jT�>�'����0�w)����␀␀␀␀␀4�m?����������ۣ�ҾS���Û޻�N��w_w]U�����g�����ځ��ޅ�E�[v���k�3��ܵ���Υ���hz����1+�����␀␀␀␀␀��n��wSz�{ӡ��Sӹ ����e7�}篦s/�H�׏<���Q,;�N~���s�c>�o���۹�i_綧��wb�������*���� ��e>�B:7�:���s�Ǥ�/�?���\om�+�␀␀␀␀␀4٪~�w)���p���_OWz��]?�kpُ?�N�ٸ����M��p�t��]��w����z��/M��1Y�t������]5m~%�f�3i�u�u��#i�w�ʘH�K�_�-��U6�p��؜��A3�lI>�����Ӷ�+�����4�cK��#��x��\�!�����{��337R�&��Ė�␀␀␀␀␀��m�z~���4���ԫ�� e��4��o_Ц��TLa�g���ّ����t1�,�Қjp��������η��Tq������ݱ���9��[|�辴{�^�m�y]����iK���{<���sG�1�<z��vo�X����t9�M��?���؛�|���*�޷ͅ��O�Ac�;m{␀␀␀␀␀���3~�m~��B��$u.��?oU��qw�K�-��wSz��t�~s.]9{,=�����+���0x�>�s�U�� ~3S;V�5�Si�G �� ��w�-�y�ޝ����o�3sOo�;e�;��"۞��A띶=␀␀␀␀␀w��8��z��{m2�y��l~�繫�d�9�Y�v:M��]��l}1��p8=�?�в~��<?�v�gi-vd%���z��y����K=g�����׳��t��}�f����+_��pfGo}� Z��␀␀␀␀�����w�';�ܹ�/
